metadata.synopsis: Problems with his rocket compel space-traveling vigilante Shep Ramsey (Hulk Hogan) to spend some time on Earth. Plunking himself down in the middle of suburbia, he rents a room from Charlie (Christopher Lloyd) and Jenny Wilcox (Shelley Duvall). Shep attempts to acclimate himself -- he skateboards, he accosts a mail carrier -- but he's destined to be a fish out of water. But when his outer space enemies arrive and pick a fight with his new friends, Shep is ready to prove his mettle.

reviews: Minor but pleasant comedy with touches of satire.
Goofy '90s Hulk Hogan comedy has lots of slapstick violence.
Lat at night you ask yourself, "How do films like this get made?"
Hey, at least Hogan's consistent with his cinematic output. Consistently awful.
Hulk Hogan an alien? I suspected as much. Watch for the cameo by Mark "Undertaker" Callaway.
Shows why Hulk Hogan should've stuck to the wrestling ring.
By golly, by the time it was over, I was feeling kind of tired of going to the movies.
